revised_title: Seasonal and Geographic Variations in D and E Region Winds over Europe
tldr: This study investigates the wind regime at an altitude of about 100 km using the meteor-radar method in Europe. The authors found that winds in the D and E regions can be approximated by Fourier series, with prevailing winds and periodic components undergoing seasonal and geographical variations. The study also highlights the similarities in wind patterns between the Northern and Southern Hemispheres.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Atmospheric Science
